a.title: From the desk of Mr Kowalski

img.title: From the desk of Mr Kowalski
img.alt: Coping with Uncertainty and Finding Hope

div.a: Coping with Uncertainty and Finding Hope

br.span: The coronavirus pandemic has dramatically changed the way we approach learning across the country and throughout the world. Students and families are not only coping with the upheaval of school, work and possibly their health or finances, they are also missing out on experiences

a.title: Daily Update
A Guide To Remote Learning

br.span:
Stay healthy! Get a good night’s sleep, eat healthy and drink water
Connect with your teacher(s) and complete your assignments
Spend time reading

a.title: From the desk of Mr. Kowalski

img.title: From the desk of Mr. Kowalski

b.span: IMPORTANT COMMUNICATION from Mark Kowalski, Superintendent

a.title: Closure Update

span.div: Today, Liberty-Benton and school districts across the country are grappling with closures due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.

As a community, it is vital that we take care of each other during this challenging time by following state and local directives, and by taking personal and collective steps to limit the impact of this virus.

a.title: Less Millage

img.title: Less Millage
img.alt: Liberty-Benton School District Bond To Collect Less Millage, Decreases Impact On Taxpayers

div.a: Liberty-Benton School District Bond To Collect Less Millage, Decreases Impact On Taxpayers

br.span: The millage amount approved by voters in May 2019 for the Liberty-Benton Local School District bond issue has been reduced from a 5.5-mill true tax impact to a 4.35-mill true tax impact.

span.div: 86.1% of the Class of 2019 earned college credit hours while attending LB.
The Class of 2019 earned a total of 1497 semester hours of college credit. (There are 93 seniors in the Class of 2019.)

div.div: 9 seniors earned a 30 or higher on their ACT. (9.5%)
All members of the Class of 2019 took the ACT with a class average of 22.33. The state average is 20.8

div.span: 53% of the class received scholarship money totaling $451,970 for their first year and $1,562,430 over their four years of college.
Liberty-Benton: Where Eagles learn to soar!
